CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Needs Analysis stage positioned above or below the Negotiation stage?
SRP.A: The Needs Analysis stage is positioned {above} the Negotiation stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Negotiation?
VE.A: The value of stage Negotiation is {427}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {704}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Initial Contact, with a value of {848}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Client Onboarded, with a value of {165}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis?
SC.A: Decreased by {144} Clients from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Negotiation to stage Contract Signed?
SC.A: Decreased by {143} Clients from stage Negotiation to stage Contract Signed.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 632? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Initial Contact} stage has {848}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {704}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 493? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Negotiation} stage has {427}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {284}, the {Client Onboarded} stage has {165}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 224 and 632? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Proposal Sent} stage has {560}, the {Negotiation} stage has {427}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {284}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis, or from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Initial Contact} to {Needs Analysis} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Contract Signed to Client Onboarded, from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Contract Signed} to {Client Onboarded}, {Initial Contact} to {Needs Analysis}, and {Needs Analysis} to {Proposal Sent} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Initial Contact} and {Needs Analysis} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Contract Signed} and {Client Onboarded} stages.
